website_summaries.verdict: Those in need of a speedy portable storage device that can handle a rough, dirty or wet environment, the G-Tech G-Drive EV ATC is an excellent buy.
pros: The G-Tech G-Drive EV ATC with Thunderbolt is fast, tough and supports both USB 3.0 and Thunderbolt connections
The outer shell is watertight, the internal drive can be swapped out with other drives in G-Tech's EV series
cons: The drive is bulky, limited to only 1TB capacity and expensive if you're not looking for a durable drive

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a number of G-Technology drives and never had a problem until I bought this one. So far, in the 8 months or so that I've had it, it's corrupted itself three times, requiring me to recover its data, format it, and put the data back on. With a 1TB drive, you can imagine how exhausting and time consuming that can be. So, expect to have to buy another drive to keep a back up of this drive for when it no longer mounts, or buy software to recover all your data. Really disappointing. For so long, G-Technology drives were the best money could buy. I'd steer clear of this one if I were you.

I like the fact that drives can be changed out in the case and the thunderbolt connector on the case makes the drive future proof as evidenced by the new MacBook pro's.

customer_reviews.title: Larger than expected, but built pretty solid
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit larger than I had thought, but still feels solid. I haven't tested the waterproof-ness of it, but the rubber gasket looks like it'd do the trick. The built-in Thunderbolt cable is a good length, and the ability to take out the drive and use it as a USB 3.0 connection is nice. The case has a nice finish that so far has been able to keep a p-touch sticker on it (I know that can be a problem with some other drives).
